byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Cairo, and Saeed Al-Batati from Al Mukalla, Yemen.

abstract: Ismail Ould Cheikh Ahmed, United Nations special envoy on Yemen, announces suspension of peace talks to end war in country, which have extended for over three months; says talks will resume in one month, but suspension calls into question tentative cease-fire and stability of country.

headline.print_headline: Suspended Yemen Talks Leave Cease-Fire in Doubt
headline.main: Talks to End War in Yemen Are Suspended

snippet: The suspension of negotiations after more than three months leaves a shaky cease-fire in doubt and threatens to deepen a humanitarian crisis....
lead_paragraph: The suspension of negotiations after more than three months leaves a shaky cease-fire in doubt and threatens to deepen a humanitarian crisis.
